questions.text: A mass casualty of 30 patients was brought to ER. They were injured during a road traffic accident and immediately rushed to hospital. which of the following colour code and explanations is correctly matched?

options.label: C
options.text: Yellow- stable patients, observation required in hospital

questions.correct_answer: C. Yellow- stable patients, observation required in hospital
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Yellow- stable patients, observation required in hospital Yellow colour in triage indicates stable patients and observation is required in the hospital.

Highyeild:

Triage : Triage means ‘to sort’ and is the cornerstone of the management of mass casualties It aims to identify those patients who will benefit the most by being treated the earliest, ensuring ‘the greatest good for the greatest number. Triage Areas : A good water supply, good lighting and ease of access are useful Separate areas should be reserved for patient holding, emergency treatment and decontamination (in the event of discharge of hazardous materials) Documentation for Triage : A system of colour-coded tags attached to the patient’s wrist or around the neck should be employed by emergency medical services. The colour denotes the degree of urgency with which a patient requires treatment

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Red- dead or deceased - Critical, but likely to survive if the treatment is given early Option: B. Black- minor injuries - Not breathing, pulseless, so severely injured that no medical care is likely to help Option: D. Green- needs immediate intervention - Stable, likely to survive even if treatment is delayed for hours to days
